header.title: The Goetia: The Lesser Key of Solomon the King (The Luciferian Edition)
header.category: Western Esotericism, Occultism, Grimoire Tradition, Luciferianism, Left Hand Path Magic

central_thesis: This edition reworks the traditional Goetia grimoire into a modern Luciferian framework, emphasizing self-deification and the development of the individual's Will and Self through Antinomian Left Hand Path techniques. It reinterprets Goetic spirits as initiatory forces and archetypal aspects of the sorcerer's psyche to be integrated and commanded internally, moving beyond conventional binding paradigms.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Preliminary Definition of Magick & Black Magick
structure_content.summary: This section defines Magick as conscious elevation and self-ascension, distinguishing it from profane behavior. Black Magick is presented as Self-Deification through Antinomian processes, moving between waking and dreaming worlds. The 'Circle' is reinterpreted as a 'Span of self-control' rather than a protective barrier, stressing that the greatest enemy is within. Black Witchcraft focuses on integrating 'shadow aspects' of the psyche for self-development.

The Goetia is contextualized as a 'low' magic grimoire historically, but is reinterpreted through 'Theurgy' (High Magick) as a path for self-development and 'Light' (self-perception), with Lucifer as the initiator. It contrasts the LHP's pursuit of consciousness as independent from the 'Ain Soph' with the RHP's goal of union with divine light. The author acknowledges Aleister Crowley's influence but presents a new, Luciferian approach to the Goetia as an 'essential tool'.

This section introduces the cardinal Infernal Princes: LUCIFER (East, Light Bearer, Azazel, liberator, individualized self-perception), LEVIATHAN (West, Crooked Serpent, Daemon of Immortality, initiation), SATAN (South, Adversary, Set-an, Fire Djinn, self-illumination), and BELIAL (North, wicked one, Spirit of Earth, powerful daemonic/angelick initiator, infernal and celestial associations).

The 'Shadow forms' of the Infernal Princes are described: SAMAEL (East, Angel of Fire, Demon prince, connected to Lilith), AZAEL (West, Angel of Death, Realm of Twilight), AZAZEL (South, Fire Djinn, Scape Goat, sexual force), and MAHAZAEL (North, Lord of Earth, Consume and Devour, Grand Daemon).

structure_content.chapter_title: The Rite of the Coiling Dragon
structure_content.summary: This ritual details an 'averse trance-way of the Adversary' where the initiate becomes like Shaitan by invoking the Four Infernal Princes and Sub-Princes (Azazel, Samael, Mahazael, Azael). The purpose is to encircle the self in 'Black Light and Cunning Fire' to achieve isolation and strength against the 'natural order', leading to an 'Azal’ucel' awakening.

Demonic Spirits are defined as 'chthonic/infernal forces' and 'phantasms' that serve as testing grounds for initiation. They are presented as mirrors of the self, revealing the 'Luciferian Mind' and strengthening the sorcerer through association and invocation, rather than being feared or kept out of a protective circle. They are to be approached with clear initiatory intent.

Angelic spirits are described as 'celestial or empyrean forces' associated with Lucifer, representing higher articulated solar and lunar shadow forms of the initiatic guide. They possess both demonic and infernal aspects, fostering balance and self-perception. Invocation is through 'resolve and silent perception', commanding them as Lucifer would.

The 'Body of Light' is the astral double used to align with the Angelic Familiar/Higher Self, referred to as 'Azal’ucel'. It is developed through meditation and visualization of a fiery essence with an 'Eye' (Set/Shaitan), aiming for instinctual communication and self-awakening in 'Luciferian Light'. It is also applied in scrying and tarot workings.

The 'Body of Shadow' is the demonic/infernal aspect of the self, developed through meditation and dreaming. It is seen as the 'Devil-initiatic guide' (Mephistopheles, Belial, Lucifuge, Shaitan, Lilith-Hecate, Ahriman) and the 'Vampyric Guide' for astral travel to the Sabbat. This practice involves absorbing demonic elementals and emotions for self-transformation.

The Goetic triangle is reinterpreted as a meeting place of spirits, with its three points referring to aspects of Hecate. The traditional name MICHAEL within the central circle is replaced by AZAZEL, symbolizing the sorcerer's self-association with Azazel/Lucifer for Antinomian self-deification. This approach emphasizes the magician's Will for control, adding a 'real sense of danger' to the rite. Names surrounding the triangle are ANAPHEAXETON, TETRAGRAMMATON, and PRIMEUMATION.

structure_content.chapter_title: THE ATHAME OR BLADE OF THE WHITE HILT
structure_content.summary: This tool, the 'Magickal Tool of the Work of Illumination', represents the 'Solar and Luciferian Blade of the Divine Will'. It is used for circulating light and envisioning around the self. The handle is to be decorated with runes for summoning and protection, and the blade consecrated during the hour of Mercury (Ram or Scorpion) or waning Moon, using fire, water, salt, Abramelin Oil, and the magician's blood, invoking Azazel and Hecate.

Designated as the 'blade of Barbarous Evocation', this knife is dedicated to Shaitan of Midnight and Banal, representing the 'Daemonic Adversarial Blade of Lucifer'. It is used for making the circle and directing spirits into the triangle. Consecration involves the hour of Saturn (waning moon), a distilled water container with blackened pepper, Hecate Oil, blood, and envisioning underworld fires and the 'serpent tongue of Shaitan'.

The Wand embodies the 'fiery essence of the Magician' and the 'Will of the Work'. It should reflect the sorcerer's sacred symbols and desires (Austin Spare's Alphabet of Desire). It is to be crafted and decorated under the 'Noon Tide Sun', sacred to Shaitan, and symbolizes the Phallus and the 'solar vessel which spills forth the Elixir of the Sun'.

The Pentacle is presented as a symbol of strength and the 'conceptual imagery of the Pentacle of Solomon', representing the 'Will of God' (SET/Divine Will). It can be worn to symbolize the 'Mind in Unity with the Will'. Names within it – GRAM, MA, TON, BELLONY, HALLIZA, ABDIA, SOLUZEN, BALLATON – are explained as representing the summoned spirit (Soluzen) and various attributes related to hearing, understanding, appearance, and union with the spirit.

This is a 'Fetish or Urn', akin to an 'nganga', serving as the 'home' for spirits. The magician creates or obtains it to summon and bind spirits, viewing it as a womb for the daemon of the Sun or Moon. Preparation involves purification by dawn light, scribing a binding sigil, and optionally adding the magician's blood. An optional, dangerous method involves 'Sexual technique of self-fascination' for binding.

The Black Mirror is a tool for scrying, divination, and communication with spirits and shades of the dead, considered a gateway to other realms and for 'Atavistic Resurgence'. It's used to visualize the bound spirit's form and impressions, facilitating communication and even direct interaction by bringing the 'astral/ghost realm into the physical plane'.

This technique involves placing the spirit's vessel or doll in the evocation triangle and using sexual desire, envisioned as a 'black serpent', to enflame the self and materialize the spirit. The sigil is anointed with sexual fluids (solitary or with a partner) at climax, focusing on the spirit's desire, followed by banishing the force through 'forgetting' or other techniques.

This section briefly refers to the ceremonial requisites suggested by the 'Clavicula Salomonis Regis' (Mathers/Crowley edition), including perfumes, incense, and a sacred bath. The 'Adornation of the Bath' is a ritual statement for preparing the body and mind for the 'Great Work', embracing both 'abstinence and fornication'.

Each of the 72 Goetic spirits is reinterpreted as an initiatory force for self-development within the Luciferian system. Their traditional offices are mapped to psychological and spiritual attributes, such as guiding astral projection, divination, communication, wisdom, specific skills, or the integration of shadow aspects. The descriptions emphasize working 'with' the spirits as aspects of self, rather than simply commanding external entities, maintaining respect yet firm Will.

key_concepts.definition: The art of Self-Deification through Antinomian processes, where the self separates from the natural order to explore the in-between worlds of waking and dreaming. It involves working with 'shadow aspects' of the psyche for self-development and becoming.

A spiritual and philosophical path focused on individual evolution, self-deification, independence, and the development of Will and Self through Antinomian Left Hand Path techniques. Lucifer is revered as the liberator, light-bearer, and initiator of the self.
A sigillic word formula combining Azazel and Lucifer, representing the illuminated Self, the initiator or Genius of the Holy Guardian Angel Rite, and the 'Daemonic Angel of Adversarial Awakening'.

The astral double used to align with the Angelic Familiar/Higher Self (Azal'ucel). It is developed through meditation and visualization of a white or fiery essence, often with an 'Eye' (Set/Shaitan), for instinctual communication, foresight, and self-awakening in Luciferian Light.

The demonic/infernal aspect of the self, developed through meditation and dreaming. It serves as the Devil-initiatic guide (e.g., Mephistopheles, Belial, Lilith-Hecate) and the 'Vampyric Guide,' allowing the 'dreaming body' to travel astrally and absorb demonic elementals for self-development.

Reinterpreted as internal, initiatory forces or archetypal aspects of the sorcerer's psyche, rather than external entities to be bound by fear. They are invoked or evoked to develop Will, perception, gnosis, and specific skills, leading to self-transformation and deification. The sorcerer aims to become 'one' with these forces.

A core Left Hand Path technique involving the conscious separation of the self from the 'natural order' (societal/religious norms, perceived limitations) to achieve individual self-deification and unique spiritual evolution, often by embracing adversarial or 'forbidden' paths.

The process of remanifesting 'inspiration aspects of obsessional perception,' serving as an instinctual guide that leads to subconscious communication with the Serpent-Angel/Azal'ucel. It is the directional point for the sorcerous path, rejuvenating obsession into flesh through 'Will-Desire-Belief' to destroy unnecessary ideals.

Not a barrier to keep forces out, but a 'Span of self control' or a 'concentration point' where the sorcerer summons forth energies within themselves. It represents the 'Great Arcana of the "I", or Luciferian Being,' emphasizing that the sorcerer does not fear, but embraces and controls forces by Will.

practical_system.description: The system outlines a path of 'Self-Deification through Antinomian processes,' requiring the integration of both 'Body of Light' (angelic/higher self) and 'Body of Shadow' (demonic/infernal aspects) to achieve a balanced, strong, and independent self. Goetic spirits are invoked/evoked as initiatory forces to develop Will, perception, and specific skills, rather than being merely commanded for external tasks. The core practice involves internalizing these forces and becoming 'one' with them through conscious Will and self-enchantment.
tools: Evocation Circle/Triangle (redefined) with names ANAPHEAXETON, TETRAGRAMMATON, PRIMEUMATION, and AZAZEL in the center.
The Athame or Blade of the White Hilt (for illumination/Divine Will)
The Black Hilted Knife (Evocation Dagger) (for banishing/commanding)
The Wand (fiery essence of Magician's Will, phallic symbol)
The Pentacle of Tetragrammaton (symbol of Will, worn) with names GRAM, MA, TON, BELLONY, HALLIZA, ABDIA, SOLUZEN, BALLATON.
The Vessel of Solomon (urn/pot for binding spirits)
The Black Mirror (for scrying, divination, spirit communication)
Bath salts and Abramelin Oil for ritual bath
Sigils of Goetic spirits (both traditional and redesigned)
Grave soil, images, specific perfumes (for Vessel)
Doll or effigy (to hold spirit in Triangle)
rituals: The Rite of the Coiling Dragon (Invocation of Four Infernal Princes and Sub-Princes)
An Invocation to the Holy Guardian Angel, Spirit of the Adversary who resides in Darkness and Light ~ Azal'ucel
Invocation of the Adversary (Shaitan/Iblis, Satan, Lucifer, Set, Azazel)
Upon the Hour of Noon - Invocation of the Djinn of Fire
Ritual Evocation with the Black Mirror
The Conjurations: The 72 Spirits of the Shemhamforasch (general invocation for any spirit N)
The Invocation of the King: Being Amaimon, Gaap, Paimon or Zodimay
Specific invocations/workings for each of the 72 Goetic spirits, often involving meditation, dream work, or visualization with the Black Mirror.

relevant_quotes.text: The essence of this book is exploring the Luciferian foundations of human evolution, the next step in our spiritual and philosophical ideologies.

Black Magick as revealed in current standards is the art of Self-Deification through Antinomianian processes, that by the self separating from the natural order do we move in-between the world of waking and dreaming.

The Circle in the modern context of Magick and Ceremonial Workings is not designed to keep forces out, such as being a philosophy which if employed in this manner, will lay a foundation which causes the magician to fail from the start. The Circle is a Span of self control; it is our influence of who we are and what we will become. Do not fear forces outside the self, your greatest enemy is within.
In the modern world of magicians, Sathan is our initiator and stimulator of the psyche.
The Daimons/Djinn of the Goetia are initiatory forces as well.
My original focus was to rework the Goetia in a modern Luciferian form, which focused on the development of the Will and the Self through Antinomian Left Hand Path techniques.
One should remember, it is the Limitless Light from which Azazel – Lucifer sought to be independent from.

The Luciferian model is presented strongly in this book, as this is a gateway or key to the mind expanding and developing. No longer shall the horrid sickness of Christianity be brought down in the Goetic Work – No longer shall the weak of mind approach this tome without duress.

The Luciferian spirit is fire born, alive, vigorous and strong in Will and Pride. Lucifer Ascends in the Sun, and Falls with the Darkening of the Moon. This is the Path of Magick itself – AS ABOVE, SO BELOW.

The sorcerer now moves forward into the Point between the summoner and the summoned. This is the Axis of which all change, self-deification and the widdershins dance of the Adversary is accomplished and developed.

The sorcerer shall seek the fire-spirit of change, rebellion and progression. The symbol of Set the Adversary shall take the earthen form of the Devil, the solar creative (and destructive) force of change and self-deification.

critical_analysis.relevance: This edition is highly relevant in modern occultism for its radical reinterpretation of the traditional Goetia grimoire through a Luciferian/Left Hand Path lens. It moves away from the Judeo-Christian framework of binding demons by divine names, instead positioning the Goetic spirits as archetypal forces within the magician's psyche, or as initiatory guides for self-deification and personal evolution. It builds upon Aleister Crowley's psychological approach but pushes it further into antinomian and adversarial spirituality. It offers a framework for integrating 'shadow aspects' and developing individual Will, distinct from paths seeking union with an external divine light.
critical_analysis.target_audience: Practitioners of the Left Hand Path, Luciferianism, Chaos Magic, and those interested in self-deification, adversarial gnosis, and psychological interpretations of grimoire magic. It is explicitly not for the 'weak of mind' or those seeking to avoid 'profane behavior' as defined by conventional society, emphasizing a path of intentional self-transformation and the acceptance of inherent 'danger' in exploring one's inner depths.
